# Welcome Aboard, Rookie
**Gear up, team up, and exterminate!** Become the ultimate mech pilot in **BIG SHOTS**, the action-packed VR roguelite where you’ll battle alien hordes, earn upgrades, and forge an unstoppable mech to reclaim Earth.

![{"height":320,"type":"image","width":1280}](https://scontent.oculuscdn.com/v/t64.5771-25/39031478_1056608452803444_322145441481672917_n.png?_nc_cat=109&ccb=1-7&_nc_sid=6e7a0a&_nc_ohc=p3yivO5ERIgQ7kNvgEcZgU9&_nc_ht=scontent.oculuscdn.com&oh=00_AYC7CasBLd5kQcO15sS7XPUaUZLUwoG0jZT-KYfAPQvtFg&oe=66DC1A7A)

An experiment gone wrong unleashed a relentless alien invasion, plunging humanity into chaos. Price Inc. initiated the **BIG SHOTS Initiative** to fight the invaders; this is where you come in, rookie. Become a **Big Shot** and take on the pivotal role of an alien exterminator. As you **gear up** and **evolve** your mech, you’ll venture deeper into infested areas in search of the source of all this mayhem.

![{"height":320,"type":"image","width":1280}](https://scontent.oculuscdn.com/v/t64.5771-25/75254877_826971082871190_832990293755662296_n.png?_nc_cat=105&ccb=1-7&_nc_sid=6e7a0a&_nc_ohc=wLC-7GLxb5gQ7kNvgF-Dzjm&_nc_ht=scontent.oculuscdn.com&oh=00_AYCuZuvzDgDoogyc4XXFK1Y6ZTJbbc8S6Tjfs8-bnlvFTQ&oe=66DC2CAC)

Exterminations can be done **solo** or **side by side with a fellow big shot**. When teamed up, working together is key to holding off alien scum and getting the job done. **Cross-platform play is supported**, so none of your friends will be left out!
![{"height":320,"type":"image","width":1280}](https://scontent.oculuscdn.com/v/t64.5771-25/38974792_1561432121079023_4158951050378786944_n.png?_nc_cat=102&ccb=1-7&_nc_sid=6e7a0a&_nc_ohc=uB_dptbqlC0Q7kNvgG3VnVY&_nc_ht=scontent.oculuscdn.com&oh=00_AYCRiUL-MbVNkd1u8FQ5oqvdaTWv2RNMtkPcszyeu8gqqA&oe=66DC2529)

**Evolve** your humble mech with upgrades during runs, becoming the **ultimate alien exterminator** in your crazy rogue-lite adventure. Explore the possibilities and combinations from the **upgrades** presented to you, or **change your loadout** with the **permanent upgrades** that you can acquire in the **shop** back at the **hangar**!
![{"height":320,"type":"image","width":1280}](https://scontent.oculuscdn.com/v/t64.5771-25/38974750_1455262358473342_3113815691243786796_n.png?_nc_cat=104&ccb=1-7&_nc_sid=6e7a0a&_nc_ohc=YLX9fJi-fOQQ7kNvgF360ag&_nc_ht=scontent.oculuscdn.com&oh=00_AYBjc9UfNez5Cse11PSkTExPW8z7FJrTDFKrWMg7NdlT_A&oe=66DC421B)
Take advantage of our **innovative movement system** to **move around freely in a swift, immersive, and comfortable manner**. No more standing in predefined positions or being restricted by teleportation, but **unlimited mobility** and opportunities at your disposal.

changelog.change_log:
- Fixed an issue where gun buddies weren't properly being displayed \n
- Fixed a few crashes that could occur when leaving a game.
Fixed an issue with the lightbake for Desert Desolation.

Hotfix 

We hotfixed a few issues that arose in the last build: the jetpack efficiency upgrades now work as intended, the enemy spawn positions are no longer half in the air, and the difficulty scaling works as it did before.

Changes:
* cockpit Cosmetics! You can now choose a Hanger and a Trinket to spruce up your mech's interior!
* Even more cosmetics! We have also added more hats and gun buddies .
* Multiple tweaks to the Tutorial have been made:
   * We have added a little extra to the tutorial intro to give some more lore as to what you are doing and why.
   * Previously we locked the rotation settings to only "Drag Rotation" during the tutorial, and allowed more options later after the tutorial. This was to encourage players to use our new (better) system. We have now allowed all rotation options form the very start. Enjoy!
   * We have removed the 'skip tutorial' option the very first time a new player starts the game, when the tutorial starts automatically. This is because we noticed that a lot of players skipped the tutorial, got frustrated by not knowing the controls in the game, and quit. We understand you guys wanting to get into the action as fast as possible, but please take the 5 minutes to figure the controls out first .
* We've added functionality to skip the splash screens at the start of the game. Just press any button!
* We have added our discord code so that more people will be able to join our discord and game together.
* Made the Mini Bosses more SCARY! They now rumble the ground, shaking your mech and your soul in anticipation!

Major fixes:
* We have added some more colliders to still allow you guys to climb and explore, but not soft-lock yourselves. This is for your own protection .

Minor fixes:
* Applied several balancing tweaks.
* Some upgrade descriptions had variables that were not filled correctly. This should now be the case.
* Some posters in the ending scene have been corrected to the correct ones, go check them out (if you can).
* Some errors were not localized, this should now no longer be the case.
* Fixed an issue with the Flyer Boss stinger colors not changing as part of the phase changes.
* There was an issue with the first hit on enemies not updating their healthbar correctly, displaying it as full. This should no longer be the case, and show the correct amount immediately.
* We have adjusted our haptics system to allow more settings for playstation and other platforms.
* We fixed an issue where the music would occasionally desync with the action. This should now no longer happen.
* Previously the Dash indicator light only communicated the cooldown. Now, it also takes fuel into account, as you cannot dash without fuel, so this is now more accurate.

Changes

More languages! In addition to English and Japanese, we now also offer text and subtitles in the following languages:

* Dutch
* Chinese (Simplified)
* French
* German
* Italian
* Korean
* Spanish

You can find these languages in the Settings menu.

Notes

To improve subtitle readability we added a bit more delay between voice lines depending on the languages, giving you more time to read them.

MAJOR FIXES
We have pre-emptively fixed an issue with the “Buy All Cosmetics” Achievement & Trophy. This should now work even if we remove and add items from the Cosmetics menu.
We have fixed issues with the “Explode on Impact” and “Boobytrap” Grenade Launcher upgrades: these should now be much easier to use.
We have resolved issues with the “Life Drain” and “Vampiric Damage” permanent upgrades! These should now FOR SURE work as indented:
Life Drain should have a 50% chance of triggering and give a small amount of HP back.
Vampiric Damage should have a 100% chance of triggering and give a slightly larger amount of HP back, but you also take more damage from enemy attacks.

CHANGES
We have added much more sounds in the hangar and in -game, so keep an ear out!
Queen makes sounds when changing phases.
Hangar buttons now make sounds consistently
Equipping weapons, cosmetics and upgrades now make some noise!
The mechs in the victory scene now make some noise!
You will get a unique noise after picking an upgrade in-game depending on their rarity.
The Slicer and Droughtwave upgrades now have SFX!
You now get a sound when being invited to join a game and receive a friend request!
We added a sound to our error pop-up, but hopefully you won’t hear that one a lot :wink:.
We have added a new screen to the mech stats panel! You can now see a list of all upgrades you have acquired throughout your Run!
We have improved stability across the board (We realize this is vague but it’s just code refactoring and guard clauses: most actual fixes were contained in the previous Hotfix patch.)
Purchasing an item while having an empty equipment slot equipped now automatically equips that item.
We have added lights to the mech’s headlights in the Hangar!
Bugparts now no longer get collected if your tank is full, giving your partner a chance to pick more up!
Now that Life Drain and Vampiric Damage have been fixed, we’ve tuned their numbers a bit:
Life Drain has a 50% chance to convert 3% of damage done to mech health. (aka: for each 1000 damage you deal you should heal 15 hp.)
Vampiric damage has 100% chance to convert 10% of damage done to mech health. (aka: for each 1000 damage you deal, you deal 900 damage and heal 100 health.) BUT also enemies do double damage to you. (NOTE: This is meant to give a “safe” and “unsafe” option, one that supports a little bit constantly, and one with high risk-reward.)
Made it possible to shoot through fences in maps that have fences.
The Grenade Launcher has been buffed from 160 to 210 (Note: We received feedback that the Grenade Launcher was quite underpowered compared to the Flak, especially after a few good upgrades. This should make the damage more reliable; from two grenades barely killing a 300hp Grunt to two grenades for sure killing a 300hp Grunt and heavily damaging the ones around it):
Grenade direct hit damage has been uptuned from 60 to 80.
Grenade AOE damage has been uptuned from 100 to 130.

MINOR FIXES
We have fixed issues with our enemy navigation, which was causing enemies to get stuck in place.
We fixed an issue when equipping the “Empty” item: this should now be much easier to use.
We have implemented various smaller UI fixes:
The microphone icons have gotten an update.
Fixed the Spewer boss missing SFX for their laser attack.
Fixed wall visuals in The Abyss
Fixed an issue with the slicer upgrades no showing particles correctly.
Drastically reduced the the “Immune” text spam when hitting bosses with weapons like Laser and Flamethrower.
Fixed some surplus text in subtitles.
Downtuned the particles related to Lifesteal upgrades (they should now accurately convey the amount gained)
We have fixed some floor colliders having the wrong mask causing loot to fall through floors (Tangled Nest).
Removed a surplus spawn point in The Yard which causing players to spawn outside of the map.

“Visit all maps” achievement has been fixed. This should now unlock correctlty.

Some more fixes to do with waves not starting/ending have been resolved. (As a backup we’ve also implemented a failsafe to catch issues and make losing runs like this much less likely.)

Fixed an instance of mudmuncher getting stuck in specific situations.

The issues with upgrades getting randomly removed are also resolved!

Changes
Enemies:
The Mudmuncher (the digging enemies):

Attack hitboxes have been reduced in size, allowing you to dodge much easier.

Mudmunchers will now also exit the ground much more often, giving more opportunities to hit them.

The Enemy Waves that spawn during Bosses have been spread out much more, giving breaks between waves and giving you the opportunity to do some heavy damage!

The Queen’s Stalagmite attack is now the same size as the Mudmuncher Boss’ Stalagmite attack, making it easier to dodge.

The Spewer now needs to have uninterrupted LOS to a target before attempting to fire a salvo. (This is additionally to also having to succeed an “Arch” check to see if the projectile would reach).

Improved Grunt attacks: They will no longer get stuck outside of attack range when they are close by and can’t attack.

Locomotion
The Jetpack now uses less fuel, making it easier to remain afloat and reach some of the higher platforms. (Note: We realized not a lot of players were using the jetpack, so with this tweak we hope to make the overall jetpack experience more forgiving and rewarding).

Quality-of-Life
We have added a Recalibrate Button! You are now able to use the in-game menu to recenter yourself in the Mech and the Hangar! (Note: This is only available on the Steam version).

You can find it immediately in the Mech Menu when in a run, or under “Settings → Gameplay Settings → Recalibrate” in the Hangar.

We have added a Seated Disclaimer to the start of the game. (Note: we saw a lot of content creators standing up in their footage. Everyone is allowed to play standing, but hopefully this will make it more clear that BIG SHOTS is designed as a seated experience).

Major fixes
Game Stability Improvements! We have made dozens of changes that should result in a more stable experience and less issues overall, mostly focused on waves not starting or ending, as well as transitioning between levels.

Losing Upgrades: We have found and solved many issues that may cause players to lose upgrades during a run. That sucks! While we are confident that we have resolved the majority of causes, some edge cases may remain, so make sure to get in touch if this occurs again!

Endless Loading Screens: Fixed various instances of internal errors causing the loading screen to never disable

Fixed an issue with the Fire Rate + Upgrades: some combinations caused fire rate to reset, causing you to not have the full benefit of all upgrades. This should no longer be the case.

Fixed an issue where Highroll would reset your damage to a lower default value after the effect expired. This should no longer be the case.

Fixed an issue where “Healing” permanent upgrades (Vampiric and Lifesteal) in certain scenarios would result in the player losing health instead of gaining health. This should no longer be the case.

Minor fixes
The Jetpack handle texture was improved!

Corrected fireworks sounds in the victory celebration level.

Increased font size of the “Searching for Room” screen.

Fixed the Queen’s corpse not despawning in the victory celebration level.

Fixed a Vine being untextured in “The Portal” level.

Fixed spawnpoints in some levels that caused Bosses to appear inside of walls.
